title: Why Do I Have a Rash on My Penis?
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

content: You might have had rashes on your arms or legs, or even your face. But on your penis ? It can happen, and many things can cause it.

A rash can show up as red, purple, or dark patches on the tip of your penis or on the shaft. It might appear as smooth, pink splotches, tiny bumps, or puffy welts. It may be itchy, too. Rashes may be harmless or serious. They can come and go quickly, or linger.

content_blocks.text: You might have had rashes on your arms or legs, or even your face. But on your penis ? It can happen, and many things can cause it.

A rash can show up as red, purple, or dark patches on the tip of your penis or on the shaft. It might appear as smooth, pink splotches, tiny bumps, or puffy welts. It may be itchy, too. Rashes may be harmless or serious. They can come and go quickly, or linger.

sections.heading: Balanitis
content: Balanitis is an inflammation of the head of the penis, also called the glans penis, which can also involve the foreskin. This inflammation is more common in uncircumcised males, which means that your foreskin is still intact. If you haven’t been circumcised, it can be difficult to keep the skin beneath clean. Bacteria, sweat, and dead skin cells can build up and make the skin covering the head of the penis swell. This can lead to itching , a rash, and a discharge under the foreskin. The skin there might look red, purple, gray, or white. The area can also hurt.

Doctors call this balanitis . You have a higher chance of getting it if you have diabetes . That’s because the sugar in your urine collects under your foreskin, where bacteria begin to breed. If the head of your penis gets swollen enough you may have trouble peeing. This is a medical emergency that requires a visit to the emergency room.

If the head of your penis gets swollen enough you may have trouble peeing. This is a medical emergency that requires a visit to the emergency room.

sections.heading: Contact Dermatitis
content: This itchy rash happens when an outside substance irritates your skin. The rash may look red on lighter skin, and brown, purple, or gray on darker skin. Common culprits are chemicals in soap, cologne, detergent, or even spermicide .

An outbreak usually happens within a few minutes to a couple of hours after contact. It’s not contagious, but it can linger for up to a month. If you have a rash, think of any new products you might have used recently. Stop using them to see if your symptoms improve.

sections.heading: Drug Rash
content: Certain medications can trigger a rash. You might be allergic, or it could be a side effect of the medication.

Anti-inflammatory medications, antibiotics , and pain relievers like Tylenol can cause what doctors call “fixed drug eruptions.” These affect the genitals and can cause swollen, red, or purplish plaques with a gray center. They can also cause blisters and dark areas that appear once the inflammation goes away.
The type of reaction you have, how soon it shows up, and how severe it is depend on the medication.
An allergic reaction to a drug can sometimes cause a rash on your genitals.

sections.heading: Genital Psoriasis
content: This rash looks like shiny, red, purplish, or dark patches on the tip of your penis or on the shaft. Because it’s an area you often keep covered, the rash stays moist. It doesn’t develop thick scales the way psoriasis does on other parts of your body.
You can get it whether your penis has been circumcised or not.

sections.heading: Sexually Transmitted Diseases (STDs)
content: If you have sex with someone who has an infection or disease on their genitals, you can get it, too. Common STDs that might cause you to have a rash on your penis include:

Scabies . These tiny mites burrow under your skin and lay eggs, causing an acne -like rash and fierce itching . The spots can look red on lighter skin. You might not see them if you have darker skin, but you can feel them. You get scabies by having skin-on-skin contact for an extended period of time with someone who has it. That’s why a common way to get it is through sex.

content_blocks.text: If you have sex with someone who has an infection or disease on their genitals, you can get it, too. Common STDs that might cause you to have a rash on your penis include:

Scabies . These tiny mites burrow under your skin and lay eggs, causing an acne -like rash and fierce itching . The spots can look red on lighter skin. You might not see them if you have darker skin, but you can feel them. You get scabies by having skin-on-skin contact for an extended period of time with someone who has it. That’s why a common way to get it is through sex.

content: The itching can get worse at night. Scratching the area can lead to sores, which can become infected.

Syphilis . Condyloma lata rash is linked to the secondary stage of this STD . It causes large, raised gray or pale lesions on the genitals. You can get this disease if your penis has direct contact with a syphilis sore (called a chancre) during sex . Chancres come with primary syphilis and generally do not itch or cause pain, so you might not know you have one. Still, syphilis can lead to serious health problems.

content_blocks.text: The itching can get worse at night. Scratching the area can lead to sores, which can become infected.

sections.heading: Genital herpes
content: may cause itching, pain, and sores in your genital area. If you have this disease, you may have no obvious signs or symptoms. You can be contagious even if you have no visible sores. There is no cure for genital herpes. But medications can help reduce the symptoms and the risk of spreading the infection to others.

Genital warts are small growths on your skin that can be pale or skin-colored. They don't usually hurt much but may cause mild itching or discomfort. You get them through sexual contact with someone who has the human papillomavirus (HPV). There's no cure for genital warts, but they sometimes go away on their own. You can also get them removed by a doctor.

You can also get them removed by a doctor.

sections.heading: Yeast Infection
content: A painful rash and redness on the underside of your penis or the head of your penis can signal a yeast infection . Yeast is a common fungus , but when it grows too much, it can cause problems. A number of things can cause it to multiply, like humid conditions or if you have a weak immune system . Certain antibiotics can kill the bacteria that normally keep yeast growth in check, leading to a yeast infection .

sections.heading: Lichen Planus
content: Lichen planus is a rash that can affect one area of your body at a time, or several – including your penis. Lichen planus of the penis may cause:
It may not be itchy. But the rash sometimes turns into sores that hurt.
You can't spread lichen planus or catch it from someone else. Doctors aren't sure what causes it. But it usually goes away on its own within a year or so.

sections.heading: Eczema
content: It's not common, but you can get eczema on your genitals. It can cause these symptoms anywhere on your penis:

content_blocks.text: It's not common, but you can get eczema on your genitals. It can cause these symptoms anywhere on your penis:

content: A combination of genetics, stress, and exposure to irritants or allergens is thought to cause eczema. It's more likely to affect people with:
You can't pass eczema to a sex partner. It doesn't hurt. But if you scratch it and break the skin, you could cause an injury or infection that may be painful.

sections.heading: When to Call Your Doctor
content: Even if you don’t think it’s something serious, a rash on your penis can affect your health in different ways. See your doctor right away if you have the following symptoms:
Go to the emergency room if you have a rash on your penis and a fever. This could signal an allergic reaction or severe infection.
bullets: It’s on other parts of your body too, appears suddenly, or is spreading quickly. (These are signs of an allergic reaction. )
The rash looks like blisters, or is turning into sores.
Your penis feels warm or swollen, or the rash crusts over.
The rash leaks green or yellow fluid.
A red streak appears on your penis.

meta_description: A rash … down there? It can happen. Find out why, and when you should see a doctor.
